title: Merge Sort
subject: Data Structures
theory:
Divide array in half. Recursively sort halves. **Merge** sorted halves. 
Time: O(n log n) always. 
Space: O(n) (Not in-place).

common_mistakes.correction: Creating new arrays in every recursive call impacts memory. Use indices on same array.

interview_questions.question: Why prefer Merge Sort for Linked Lists?
interview_questions.answer: Nodes can be relinked in O(1) (in-place merge). No random access needed (unlike Quick Sort partition).

real_world_use_cases.description: Uses TimSort (Merge + Insertion) because stability is required for Objects.
